conclusion: Determine if displacements of cars A and B are the same using the velocity-time graph.
Displacement is found by calculating the area under the velocity-time graph.
Graph shows curves A and B for velocities of Car A and Car B over time.
Both curves start at v=0 at t=0 and end at velocities v1 for Car B and v2 for Car A at t=t1.
Area under curve A is bounded by curve A, x-axis, and vertical lines at t=0 and t=t1.
Area under curve B is bounded by curve B, x-axis, and vertical lines at t=0 and t=t1.
Both areas represent positive displacements as curves are above the x-axis.
Curve A starts higher than Curve B but decreases more slowly.
Curve B starts lower than Curve A but increases more rapidly.
At t=t1, Curve A reaches a higher velocity (v2) compared to Curve B (v1).
Area under curve A is larger than area under curve B because Car A maintains higher velocity longer.
Final answer: Displacement of Car A is greater than that of Car B.
